snippet: Ken Perenyi once had an extravagant life as a prolific art forger, but now he sells his faked oils as the reproductions of the masters — for a fraction of his earlier prices.
abstract: Artist Ken Perenyi made a small fortune forging paintings by popular 18th- and 19th-century artists before the FBI began tracking his work; he now makes far less money selling his reproductions legitimately; his forthcoming memoir Caveat Emptor: the Secret Life of an American Art Forger details his exploits.
lead_paragraph: Ken Perenyi once had an extravagant life as a prolific art forger, but now he sells his faked oils as the reproductions of the masters — for a fraction of his earlier prices.

headline.seo: Ken Perenyi, Art Forger, Now Sells His Work as Copies
